subject: Re: [junit] Testing a method that outputs a text file.
msgSnippet: ... I generally have methods on the class that take streams or readers/writers for input and output, and test those with ByteArrayInput/OutputStream or
messageBody:
On Wed, 9 Jun 2004, John Miller wrote:

> I've got a class method that writes out a (text) file.
> Given a known input how can I test that the output is correct.

I generally have methods on the class that take streams or
readers/writers for input and output, and test those with
ByteArrayInput/OutputStream or CharArrayReader/Writer classes. That
allows me to embed my test data directly into the test, and avoid
creating files.

Then you just add a couple of little wrapper methods that take a File
or whatever and get the Stream/Reader/Writer from it and pass it to the
tested methods. These methods are so simple that I don't bother to test
them in unit tests.
